1. Iran has one of the highest recidivism rates in the world. According to a study by the World Prison Brief, Iran has a recidivism rate of 70%, which is significantly higher than the global average of 50%.
2. Iran has a complex and challenging criminal justice system, with a high number of prisoners serving time for non-violent offenses. This can make it difficult for prisoners to reintegrate into society upon release, increasing the likelihood of reoffending.

While each of the other nationalities may also have their own unique challenges and factors that could contribute to a higher likelihood of reoffending, the available data and research suggests that Iran has a particularly high recidivism rate and a complex criminal justice system that may make it more difficult for prisoners to successfully reintegrate into society upon release.
